field.name: SBR
field.description:
Baud Rate Modulo Divisor (along with BDL[SBR])
 The 13 bits in SBR[12:0] are referred to collectively as BR. They set the modulo divide rate for the
 UART baud rate generator. When BR is cleared, the UART baud rate generator is disabled to reduce
 supply current. When BR is 1 - 8191, the UART baud rate equals BUSCLK/(16xBR)

field.name: RXEDGIE
field.description: RxD Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable (for RXEDGIF)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from RXEDGIF disabled (use polling)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RXEDGIF flag is 1

field.name: LBKDIE
field.description: LIN Break Detect Interrupt Enable (for LBKDIF)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters start + 8 data bits + 9th data bit + stop

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the UART does not use the RxD pins

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Single-wire UART mode where the TxD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation - RxD and TxD use separate pins

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Loop mode where transmitter output is internally connected to receiver input. The receiver input is determined by the RSRC bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent

field.name: RWU
field.description: Receiver Wakeup Control This field can be set to place the UART receiver in a standby state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: RWU enables the wakeup function and inhibits further receiver interrupt requests. Normally, hardware wakes the receiver by automatically clearing RWU

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1

field.name: PF
field.description: Parity Error Flag\n PF is set at the same time as RDRF when parity is enabled (PE = 1) and the parity bit in the received character does not agree with the expected parity value\n Write 1 to PF to clear

field.name: FE
field.description:
Framing Error Flag
 FE is set at the same time as RDRF when the receiver detects a logic 0 where a stop bit was expected.
 This suggests the receiver was not properly aligned to a character frame.
 Write 1 to FE to clear

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct

field.name: NF
field.description:
Noise Flag
 The advanced sampling technique used in the receiver takes three samples in each of the received bits.
 If any of these samples disagrees with the rest of the samples within any bit time in the frame, the flag NF is set at the same time as RDRF is set for the character.
 To clear NF, write logic one to the NF

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Noise detected in the received character in UART_D

field.name: OR
field.description:
Receiver Overrun Flag
 OR is set when a new serial character is ready to be transferred to the receive data buffer, but the previously received character has not been read from UART _D yet.
 In this case, the new character, and all associated error information, is lost because there is no room to move it into UART _D. 
 To clear OR, write a logic 1 to OR

field.name: IDLE
field.description:
Idle Line Flag
 IDLE is set when the UART receive line becomes idle for a full character time after a period of activity.
 To clear IDLE, write logic 1 to the IDLE flag.
 After IDLE has been cleared, it cannot become set again until after a new character has been received and RDRF has been set

field.name: RDRF
field.description: Receive Data Register Full Flag\n RDRF becomes set whenever the receive data buffer is full. To clear RDRF, read the UART data register

field.name: TC
field.description:
Transmission Complete Flag
 TC is set out of reset and when TDRE is set and no data, preamble, or break character is being transmitted.
 TC is cleared automatically by one of the following:
 - Write to the UART data register ( UART _D) to transmit new data
 - Queue a preamble by changing TE from 0 to 1
 - Queue a break character by writing 1 to UART _C2[SBK]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break)

field.name: TDRE
field.description: Transmit Data Register Empty Flag\n TDRE is set out of reset and whenever there is room to write data to the transmit data buffer.\n To clear TDRE, write to the UART data register

field.name: RAF
field.description: Receiver Active Flag\n RAF is set when the UART receiver detects the beginning of a valid start bit, and RAF is cleared automatically when the receiver detects an idle line

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver idle waiting for a start bit

field.name: LBKDE
field.description: LIN Break Detection Enable\n LBKDE selects a longer break character detection length. While LBKDE is set, framing error (FE) and receive data register full (RDRF) flags are prevented from setting

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is detected at length 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 13 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1)

field.name: BRK13
field.description: Break Character Generation Length\n BRK13 selects a longer transmitted break character length. Detection of a framing error is not affected by the state of this bit. This bit should only be changed when the transmitter is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 13 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 15 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1)

field.name: RWUID
field.description: Receive Wake Up Idle Detect\n RWUID controls whether the idle character that wakes up the receiver sets the IDLE bit. This bit should only be changed when the receiver is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character

field.name: RXINV
field.description: Receive Data Inversion\n Setting this bit reverses the polarity of the received data input

field.name: MSBF
field.description: Most Significant Bit First\n Setting this bit reverses the order of the bits that are transmitted and received on the wire

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of C1[M], C1[PE] and C4[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE]

field.name: RXEDGIF
field.description: RxD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag\n RXEDGIF is set when an active edge, falling if RXINV = 0, rising if RXINV=1, on the UART _RX pin occurs.\n RXEDGIF is cleared by writing a 1 to it

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred

field.name: LBKDIF
field.description: LIN Break Detect Interrupt Flag\n LBKDIF is set when the LIN break detect circuitry is enabled and a LIN break character is detected.\n LBKDIF is cleared by writing a 1 to it

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: No LIN break character has been detected

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: LIN break character has been detected

field.name: TXDIR
field.description: Transmitter Pin Data Direction in Single-Wire mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: TxD pin is an input in single-wire mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: TxD pin is an output in single-wire mode

register.name: D
register.description:
Data Register
 Reads return the contents of the read-only
 receive data buffer and writes go to the write-only transmit data buffer. Reads and writes
 of this register are also involved in the automatic flag clearing mechanisms for the UART
 status flags

field.name: RT
field.description: Read receive data buffer or write transmit data buffer

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit or 9-bit data characters

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN1 is cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA2 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN2 is cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA1 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock
